feature.name: Sacred Oath: Oath of the Heart
feature.text: This paladin has a deep connection to their heart and the collective heart in the multiverse. Everything they do comes from a place of love. These paladins are romantics, seeing beauty in everything. They feel their emotions intensely and act to make the world a better place.
Heart Spells:
You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.
3rd — detect evil and good, protection from good and evil
5th — detect thoughts, zone of truth
9th — beacon of hope, dispel magic
13th — crusader’s mantle, guardian of faith
17th — awaken, dispel evil and good
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the City p. 136

feature.name: Channel Divinity: Heart Sense (Oath of the Heart)
feature.text: The paladin can sense if evil creatures or evil magic is within 60 ft.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the City p. 136

feature.name: Channel Divinity: Call of the Heart (Oath of the Heart)
feature.text: The paladin calls out and any evil creature within 30 ft. must make a successful Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on their next attack.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the City p. 136

feature.name: Know Alignment (Oath of the Heart)
feature.text: The paladin knows the alignment of any creature within 30 ft.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the City p. 136

feature.name: Aura of the Heart (Oath of the Heart)
feature.text: Any ally within 10 ft. of the paladin is resistant to necrotic and poison damage.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the City p. 136

feature.name: Guided by the Heart (Oath of the Heart)
feature.text: Whenever the paladin makes a critical hit, waves of love are sent out to its allies within 30 ft. Each ally is healed for 1d6 hit points.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the City p. 136

feature.name: Holy Horse (Oath of the Heart)
feature.text: A loyal pegasus steed is sent from the divine to serve the paladin. If it’s destroyed a new one arrives at dawn.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the City p. 136

feature.name: Enduring Love (Oath of the Heart)
feature.text: Any fallen allies within 30 ft. of the paladin are immediately stabilized.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the City p. 136
